extendedInfo.description: Introducing Pro HDR Camera, the world's first real HDR app for Android! From the team that created Pro HDR for iOS, now you can automatically create stunning full-resolution HDR images with just a single tap on your Android phone. Please note that this app has been tested to work properly on Motorola, HTC and most Samsung phones. However, if you have a LG, Sony, or other device, the HDR capability may not function properly. Full functionality has been verified on the following phones:* HTC: Thunderbolt, EVO 4G, MyTouch 4G, G2, Incredible, Desire, Legend, Bravo* Motorola: Droid, Droid 2, Droid X* Samsung: Galaxy S, Epic 4G, Galaxy NexusHere are a few professional reviews of our iPhone app Pro HDR:"If you ever take photos using your iPhone, this app is a must-have." - Gizmodo"Pro HDR leaps ahead of the pack... Even if you're not into HDR photography, this is one to check out." - TUAW"Picture Perfection: Pro HDR automatically aligns and blends the images, giving you a perfectly exposed, amazing image that rivals a high-end point-and-shoot camera" - NBC Los AngelesThanks to Pro HDR Camera, you no longer have to choose between a blown-out sky or a hopelessly dark foreground. Bringing automatic high dynamic range photography to your Android phone for the first time ever, Pro HDR captures an image exposed for the highlights and another exposed for the shadows. It then aligns and merges the images, giving you a gorgeous HDR image up to 8 megapixels like nothing you've ever seen from such a tiny device.Unlike fake HDR apps that merely take a single photo and reprocess it (without actually adding any new detail), Pro HDR massively extends the dynamic range of your camera and produces beautiful results that you have to see to believe. We provide a fully automatic mode, and an assisted Manual mode for those times when you wish to choose your exact exposures. Finally, you can take stunning high-res photos of all those scenes that are just too contrasty to capture in a single picture.Not only will seasoned photographers instantly fall in love with Pro HDR, one look at our example images should convince anyone that Pro HDR represents a new era in mobile photography. Check out our gallery here: http://www.eyeapps.com/Gallery.html Pro HDR Camera for Android comes with these incredibly useful features: â¢ Automatic in-app HDR capture, where all you have to do is tap to capture â¢ Manual in-app photo capture, where you get to choose the exposure of each image in your HDR â¢ 3 Image Capture speeds to take pictures nearly instantly on phones that support it, while still compatible with older phones.â¢ Proprietary image alignment algorithm that precisely aligns full-size images in seconds â¢ Sophisticated image blending creates one beautiful output image nearly instantly â¢ Live-updating image adjustment sliders to perfect your HDR:    Choose the perfect brightness, contrast, saturation, warmth, and tint, or let Pro HDR automatically maximize image quality.â¢ Take pictures using hardware buttons (volume up/down or the shutter button if your phone has one)â¢ Silent capture - mute your shutter sounds for quiet capture* Camera ZOOM* Front Camera!â¢ Fullscreen image preview in portrait and landscape orientation â¢ Save HDR images at the full resolution of your camera.â¢ Efficient background processing that renders your HDRs while you keep on shootingâ¢ Built-in HDR gallery view to peruse, share, and re-edit your HDRsâ¢ Share your HDRs with the world with e-mail, and social networks.â¢ Google+ Instant Upload. Save to DCIM folder to enable!IMPORTANT: Pro HDR Camera requires Android 2.2 or later. Pro HDR Camera works on Motorola, HTC  and Samsung devices.The exposure functions on LG phones and the Nexus S seem to be broken, so HDR functionality will likely not work (though the rest of the features will). The Nexus S doesn't truly adjust the exposure, but seems to darken or brighten the image in software.

reviews.title: GREAT APP
reviews.comment: Gotta say this is a great HDR app i have ever used!!  Using this and little edit wit  After focus (if needed) and Instagram plug ins makes amazing pictures worth the money
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very nice images
reviews.comment: Great images with some decent features buyout pretty much have to avoid photography anything that moves. Even a soft breeze moving  trees or clouds willruin an otherwise great image
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great pictures
reviews.comment: Pics come out amazing love this app. If u like taking great pics then this is the app. U can\'t takes pics of moving objects.
reviews.author: Mark Robertson

reviews.title: Wonderful app...
reviews.comment: Really great app. Does what it promises and the results are fantastic. Turns the phone into an amazing gadget for capturing HDR photographs.  This app cannot be used to capture moving objects (pets, or trees and plants when it is windy etc.) as the app functions by capturing photos with varying exposure levels, and then merging them to give the final output. Please understand this before downloading or rating this app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Turns out beautiful balanced hdr images. Only issue is that it always saves the original pics, not just the one hdr image. Options have no effect on this
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A great tool.
reviews.comment: This does a pretty decent job, especially for an amateur like me who mostly couldn\'t be bothered doing post-process on Photoshop or such! One little annoyance (it would be five stars otherwise): It won\'t let me use external SD for saving. Creates a directory \'d\' instead, on internal SD.
reviews.author: Stephen Cotterill

reviews.title: Almost as good as it gets
reviews.comment: As a Photomatix Pro user I was very impressed with this app. The default result is so good that I rarely use the tweaks. I now use it whenever I haven\'t got my 14MP camera, and am never disappointed. My Samsung 7.7 works well, but it is a shame I can\'t get it to work on my wife\'s 10.1.
reviews.author: Richard Langford

reviews.title: amazing
reviews.comment: Simple way to get amazing, pics, I love this
reviews.author: Kristian G\303\263mez

reviews.title: Great portrait app
reviews.comment: The picture quality is the best I have seen. It does have limitations. Action shots are out of the question but most other shots are very good and portraits are excellent.
reviews.author: Philip Green

reviews.title: Pro HDR on Note
reviews.comment: Simply superb on Galaxy Note, very creative, runs smoothly, cannot fault.  I also have HDR Camera, which some folk prefer, but although good too offers far less \'control\'.  \302\243 well spent!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment: I came from the iPhone and had this app. I loved it. The quality is there on this app as well however, not being able to pull photos from my gallery to edit is drowning this app for me.  Unless I just don\'t see how to do it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I am impressed...
reviews.comment: I installed this app and took a few pictures in low level lighting without the flash. I tried to hold still, per the instructions on the screen, and I didn\'t do very well, but the picture turned out a lot better than they stock camera app ever could have done, even with a flash.  Thanks to Nate \"Blunty 3000\" Burr for recommending the app. Find him on YouTube!
reviews.author: Dave Thompson

reviews.title: Fun tool
reviews.comment: It\'s a great HDR app that really lets you have a good deal of control over how realistic or surreal your image can look. Very small learning curve.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Still learning
reviews.comment: So far I like it very much...use it less than I would bc my phone has excellent auto focus & holding still to capture using this app isn\'t always my first thought. I like the difference in landscape photos.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nexus 4 not working
reviews.comment: Been using this app on my old Galaxy Nexus, but on my new Nexus 4 it\'s not working properly (takes three identical photos for high/mid/low). Hope it\'s updated soon as Nexus 4 camera has native HDR capability which would be awesome to take advantage of.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Does what it says. Not sure how many individual shots make up the image.\tMaybe its not true HDR?
reviews.author: Bill Sherard

reviews.title: Good product
reviews.comment: I have started using this. It\'s really good, I just wish I had some cropping tools. Worth the money for sure!
reviews.author: Jonathan Hutson

reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: Takes AMAZING pictures! Just make sure your subject and scene are stationary, as the picture taking is about 5 seconds.  Highly recommend this app!
reviews.author: Mark VanOuse

reviews.title: One of the best HDR apps
reviews.comment: This is definitely one of the best HDR apps. Pro HDR Camera does a very good job every time, but in my experience HDR Camera+ does a better job when it actually works (for me it doesn\'t work in every lighting condition - Galaxy Nexus). In my opinion it\'s good to have both apps :)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: good but only shoots half res on HTC one
reviews.comment: really nice little app but i can\'t get it to shoot anymore than 1.9 mpix 1600 x 1200 on a htc one. please fix.
reviews.author: Tom Englefield
